questionTitle: The Declaration of Independence adopted on July 4th 1776 announced ___ a new nation.
The New World ___ by five European countries: Spain, Portugal, France, Holland and England.
Most European emigrants left their homelands searching for greater ___.
America ___ by native people who viewed it as their homeland.
The Pilgrims came to America in 1620 ___ the ship Mayflower.
The first permanent English settlement in America was a trading post ___ Jamestown in 1607.

The thirteen colonies ___ became the United States were Connecticut, Delaware, Georgia, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North and South Carolina, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island and Virginia.
___ by stories of abundance and opportunities, people from various nations flocked to European seaports to travel to America.
The first group of Pilgrims ___ the New World established the colony of Plymouth in 1620.
In his search ___ a route ___ the Orient, Christopher Columbus discovered the Americas ___ 1492.
